de.esoco.gwt.client.ui

Class PanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends PanelManager<?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<C>
      • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>
        • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.PanelManager<C,P>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationPanelManager, DataElementPanelManager, LoginPanelManager

    public abstract class PanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends PanelManager<?,?>>
extends de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>
    The base class for objects that create and manage a panel. A Subclass must implement the method ContainerManager.createContainer(ContainerBuilder, StyleData) to create and build the managed panel with the desired layout.

    The generic type parameters allow subclasses to define the types of the panel container (C) they build their contents in and of the parent panel manager (P) they can be associated with. This allows subclasses to access specific methods of these objects through the methods getPanel() and getParent() methods without the need for type casting.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PanelManager(P rParent, java.lang.String sPanelStyle)
      Creates a child panel manager with a certain parent panel manager.

        public PanelManager<?,?> getRootManager()
        Returns the root panel manager of this instance's hierarchy. If this instance is already the root of the hierarchy (i.e. it has no parent) it will be returned directly.
        Returns:
        The root panel manager

        Returns TRUE if currently a command execution is in progress.
        Returns:
        TRUE if a command execution is in progress

      • updateUI

        public void updateUI()
        This method can be be overridden by subclasses to update the panel content from model data if it has changed. The default implementation invokes Component.repaint() on the manager's panel.

        Attention: Invoking this method will replace any values entered into input components with the model value stored in the data elements. Therefore it should only be invoked on display UIs or when the resetting of input fields is explicitly desired.

      • addToolbar

        protected de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<de.esoco.ewt.component.Panel> addToolbar(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                                                                       de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rBackgroundStyle,
                                                                                       de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData rToolbarStyle,
                                                                                       int nColumns)
        Create a standard button toolbar panel. The toolbar panel will have the style EsocoGwtCss.gfToolbar() and the enclosing (background) panel will have the argument style.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The builder to build the toolbar with
        rBackgroundStyle - The style of the background or NULL for the default
        rToolbarStyle - The style of the toolbar or NULL for the default
        nColumns - The number of columns for a vertical toolbar or zero for a horizontal toolbar
        Returns:
        The container builder for the toolbar panel

      • addToolbarButton

        protected de.esoco.ewt.component.Button addToolbarButton(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<de.esoco.ewt.component.Panel> rToolbarBuilder,
                                                         java.lang.Object rImage,
                                                         java.lang.String sToolTip)
        Create a standard toolbar button. The builder should be one that has been returned by addToolbar(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, StyleData, int). The button will have the style EsocoGwtCss.gfToolButton().
        Parameters:
        rToolbarBuilder - The toolbar panel builder to create the button with
        rImage - The button image
        sToolTip - The optional tooltip text or NULL for none
        Returns:
        The container builder for the toolbar panel

      • addToolbarSeparator

        protected void addToolbarSeparator(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<de.esoco.ewt.component.Panel> rBuilder)
        Adds a separator to a toolbar. The builder must be one that had been returned by addToolbar(ContainerBuilder, StyleData, StyleData, int). The button will have the style EsocoGwtCss.gfToolSeparator().
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The toolbar panel builder

      • displayMessage

        protected void displayMessage(java.lang.String sMessage,
                              int nDisplayTime)
        Displays a message in the message area. Using NULL as the message argument will clear any previous message. This default implementation forwards the call to the parent panel manager if such exists. If not this method will have no effect. It can either be overridden by a certain subclass or by a parent panel manager which then handles the message display.
        Parameters:
        sMessage - The message to display or NULL to clear the message
        nDisplayTime - The time in milliseconds to display the message or zero for no timeout

      • executeCommand

        protected <T extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>,R extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> void executeCommand(Command<T,R> rCommand,
                                                                                                                              T rData,
                                                                                                                              CommandResultHandler<R> rResultHandler)
        Executes a command on a CommandService. The service is queried through the ServiceRegistry.
        Parameters:
        rCommand - The command to execute
        rData - The data to be processed by the command
        rResultHandler - The result handler to process the command result in case of a successful command execution

      • getCloseWarning

        protected java.lang.String getCloseWarning()
        This method must be overridden by subclasses that want to display a warning if the user tries to close the browser window. The returned string will then be displayed in the browser's warning message to allow the user to cancel the window closing. The returned string can be a resource.

        The default implementation will ask the parent for the close warning or return NULL if no parent exists. Therefore the typical place to implement this method is in a root panel manager.

        Returns:
        The close warning or NULL if the window can be closed without a warning

      • handleCommandFailure

        protected void handleCommandFailure(Command<?,?> rCommand,
                                    java.lang.Throwable rCaught)
        handles a command failure. Can be overridden by subclasses for more specific failure handling.
        Parameters:
        rCommand - The failed command
        rCaught - The exception that occurred

      • handleError

        protected void handleError(java.lang.Throwable rCaught)
        Performs the error handling for this manager. The default implementation forwards this call to the parent panel manager if such exists.
        Parameters:
        rCaught - The exception that caused the error

      • removeApplicationPanel

        protected void removeApplicationPanel()
        Must be implemented to remove the main panel of an application. This method can be invoked to reset the application's view. This happens typically if a user's authentication has expired.

        The default implementation invokes the parent method if a parent panel manager is set. Therefore the implementation of this method should be done in the root panel manager of the application.
